page.title: 01SHERBORNE AND S.W. AREA
page.content: {SHERBORNE}is in North West Dorset. It is an Abbey town with many historical buildings. The majority of land is owned by Winchester College and the Digby Estate. The town {population}is 9230. Light industry and tourism are important in an otherwise mainly agricultural area. There are{11 schools, }of which 5 are private. The River Yeo acts like a natural boundary for the south side for the town. To the north of the town going from east to west runs the A30 main road leading to Yeovil 5 miles away. Similarly, the Waterloo/Exeter{main {railway line}runs to the south of the A30. Points of interest in the town are: { ABBEY, NEW & OLD CASTLES, ALMSHOUSES. The surrounding countryside is largely devoted to{dairy farming.
